introduction: In this video, the North American lead from IBM Quantum discusses the best ways to increase your chances of getting an internship at IBM Quantum or any other quantum computing company. The focus is on the getting to the interview stage of the application process, with specific tips for hardware, software, and research internships. The video emphasizes the importance of making your application as specific as possible and choosing a direction based on your interests and experience.

sections.title: Section 1: Understanding IBM Quantum Internships
content: Explanation of the three IBM Quantum internship categories: hardware, software, and research.
Discussion on the specific skills and qualifications required for each category.
Overview of the application process and how hiring managers evaluate applicants.
Importance of making your application specific and tailored to your interests.

sections.title: Section 2: Tips for Hardware Internships
content: Specific skills and qualifications needed for hardware internships at IBM Quantum.
Emphasis on hands-on experience with connectors, power, and mechanical design.
Importance of software development skills for automation purposes.
Example of a hardware manager's expectations.

sections.title: Section 3: Tips for Software Internships
content: Overview of the software stack in quantum computing.
Specific languages and skills required for different parts of the software stack.
Emphasis on clean code principles and collaborative team environments.
Example of a software hiring manager's expectations.

sections.title: Section 4: Tips for Research Internships
content: Explanation of research internships at IBM Quantum.
Specific skills and qualifications needed for research internships.
Emphasis on research experience and project management.
Example of a research internship's expectations.

sections.title: Section 5: General Tips for Increasing Your Chances
content: Overview of the key takeaways from the video.
Importance of making your application specific and tailored to your interests.
Emphasis on gaining hands-on experience and developing relevant skills.
Suggestions for reaching out to industry professionals and networking.
Final words of encouragement.
